narrative: James Larry told police he was angry his family were infidels who would not conform to his Muslim culture. He shot and killed his pregnant wife, young son and three other family members. He pleaded guilty and was imprisoned without possibility of parole.
weapon: Handgun – Hi-Point 9mm semiautomatic pistol, Model C9

narrative: Two brothers have each been charged with four counts of murder and two counts of robbery in the slayings of four women inside an apartment. Police said robbery was the motive. Cedric D. Poore and James S. Poore were both sentenced to life without parole.
weapon: .40-caliber shells found by victims.

narrative: Two years after police found the bodies of three suffocated children, the body of their mother was found in a shallow grave 20 miles away. Pedro Rodriguez, 28, who was found hanged in the family's home, is believed to have killed all four.

The theft of a cheap bracelet ended in three shootings, including a drive-by that sprayed bullets at a funeral crowd, killing four teens. Jeffrey Best, Robert Bost and Orlando Carter received life without parole. Two others got 54 and 30 years in prison.
weapon: AK-47 (Simms), .45-caliber semiautomatic handgun (Bost), 9mm semiautomatic handgun (Best)

narrative: A man diagnosed with bipolar disorder and schizophrenia shot his parents, brother and 17-year-old niece at the family's longtime home. He killed himself before police arrived.

An FBI report found 18-year-old Sulejman Talovic "sought to kill as many people as possible" when he entered Trolley Mall and began shooting. Five died and four were injured. Talovic was killed by police. There is no indication why he went on his rampage.
weapon: Mossberg 88 pistol-grip pump-action shotgun and a Smith & Wesson .38 Special, Model 36 revolver

narrative: Four acquaintances who had been staying together at an Economy Inn were shot in their room on a Saturday morning. Three died at the scene; a fourth died of his injuries several days later. Scott A. Goodwin-Bey was charged with four counts of murder.  Investigators believed Goodwin-Bey thought one or all of the victims told police about his drug use. The charges were later dropped.
weapon: Ruger 9-millimeter semiautomatic handgun
situation_details: Suspected victim of informing police about assailant's drug use

narrative: Robert Bever, 18, and Michael Bever, 16, were arrested after police found five of their family members stabbed dead in their home. A 13-year-old girl was injured in the attack; a 2-year-old was unharmed. Both teens were convicted adn sentenced to life without parole.

Stemming from an ongoing dispute and apparently precipitated by his recent eviction from his mobile home, Claude Adams, 64,fatally shot Kurt Bracke and Richard Hanen at the park’s clubhouse area, police said. Adams then killed his wife and son and set fire tot eh mobile home before taking his own life.
In an apparently hate-inspired, anti-immigrant attack, the gunman traveled over 600 miles from suburban Dallas to an El Paso Wallmart to commit the shooting.
Travane Jackson and Jerrica Spellman had a years-long “ongoing domestic violence situation” before Spellman and her three young children were stabbed to death in thier apartment.

This case remains unsolved. Four young adults were found shot in the head inside a run-down house. The gunman had forced his way in. Police believe the shooting was part of an ongoing feud between two neighborhood groups.
The assailant fatally shot his parents. He then drove to the Essex Royal Farms convenient store where he shot three, two of them fatally. He then committed suicide.
notes: Geocode based on parents’ home where the shooting spree began

narrative: An illegal immigrant from Mexico, Isabel Martinez, had just lost her father whom she believed was going to hell. One night she stabbed her husband and five children. After being apprehended, she refused a lawyer and smiled for cameras. Possible mental illness, especially depression following loss of father.

Michael Cummins, 25, is accused of killing six people -- including his parents and uncle -- found in a trailer home, plus two more victims found elsewhere who were not necessarily killed on the same day.   
Cummins had a history of violence and drug problems. After being released from a year in jail for attempting to burn down his neighbor's house and assaulting her, Cummins violated his parole and was about to be arrested. He killed three family members and his uncle's girlfriend and relatives before attacking another woman, presumably to steal her car. He was found by police in a creek bed by the home, and was shot before being taken into custody.

A 14-month-old boy was spared in the slayings of a woman, her boyfriend and two of her nephews. Her former boyfriend and the father of the child, Gevante E. Anderson, was found guilty of first-degree murder and sentenced to life without parole.
weapon: 40-caliber semiautomatic handgun (casings only) (Weapon not recovered so no make and mode availablel), knife

narrative: Robert Kenneth Stewart entered a nursing home where his estranged wife worked and fatally shot seven elderly patients and a nurse. He said he had taken too many sleeping pills and could not be held responsible. He was sentenced to at least 142 years.
weapon: Shotgun, .22-cal rifle

narrative: Investigators found the bodies of a woman, her two children and her cousin. Her ex-husband Jae Hwan Shim led authorities to a fifth body in Mexico in late 2013. Shim and his friend Tae Won Kwon have pleaded guilty. Both will serve life in prison.

Chrisdale Careaga and her son/stepson were killed in their home, which was then burned. Her husband, John, was found the next day in his car, murdered and the car burned as well. Marijuana plants and 60,000 were found in the home. 

In January 2020, the Kitsap County Sheriff's Office reported that it believes "members and associates" of the Bandidos Motorcycle Club were directly involved in the murders. Investigators named Danie Jay Kelly Jr., 41, a "known associate" of the club, as a person of interest in the murders.

.

James and Donovan Cloud (with the possible assistance of two others) killed fatally shot 4 victims at a residence in the Yakima Indian Reservation, stole a car from there and shot more victims, killing 1,  inside a car nearby. The murders appear to be drug-related.

Chad Isaak, a veteran and chiropractor, went to the company that managed his mobile home park and shot and stabbed four employees there. It remains unclear if he had any relationship with the victims or what the precise motive was.
weapon: Gun, knife

narrative: Deputies went to the home on Reserve Place about 9 a.m. Monday, January 13, 2020, to assist federal agents in arresting Anthony Todt on a warrant, which is when they found the four bodies inside. Megan Todt and her children are believed to have been killed sometime toward the end of December. They were given an overdose of Benadryl and then stabbed to death,  The last time anyone spoke to Megan Todt was 12/26/2019.  Todt., a psysical therapist whose license to practice had expired was under pressure from creditors, landlords, Medicaid investigators and federal agents.
weapon: two hunting knives
notes: The date of death is approximate

narrative: The defendant stated that he had killed his mother first at about 1 p.m. He then his siblings as they returned home.

Police went to check on the Ireland family after getting a call from a relative  concerned after not been able to reach their loved ones for days. In the living room of the home, deputies found the  bodies of April Ireland, 26, Karen Ireland, 8 months, Michael Jason Ireland, 4, and Bryson Ireland, 3, all with gunshot wounds. In the master bedroom deputies found the family's dog shot dead next to Michael Ray Ireland, 39, who they suspect had killed his wife and children before taking his own life.

The Indianapolis Police were called to an apartment in the 4100 block of Shady Oak Drive just before 10:30 p.m. after a neighbor noticed a back patio door was shattered and saw someone fleeing from the residence.

Officers found four victims down inside the apartment. Three men and one woman were pronounced dead at the scene, and he Marion County Coroner has identified the victims as Marcel Wills, 20, Braxton Ford, 21, Kimari Hunt, 21, and Jalen Roberts, 19.

Four males were arrested and charged with murder. According to authorities, the murders were connected to robbery.

casenickname: Renee Jennex Small Family Home Shooting/Arson Fire
narrative: A drunken James Steven Jennex sent a text message to a friend apologizing in advance for his actions and then fired a bullet into the heads of each of three developmentally disabled men in his care before setting his Temecula-area home ablaze and killing himself with a .357 revolver blast to the head.  The fire at the Renee Jennex Small Family Home, killed a fourth developmentally disabled man and burned all five people beyond recognition. Investigators pulled a gas can from the rubble.
weapon: Gun and fire
notes: The Renee Jennex Small Family Home was a facility licensed to care for up to four developmentally-disabled residents.

narrative: Jacob Levi Shaffer is serving life sentences for killing six people, including his estranged wife and her teenage son. Hours before killing his wife's family, he beat to death a man at an Alabama marble company owned by his wife's relatives.
weapon: Large kitchen knives

narrative: Faced with the possibility of his wife leaving him, Christopher A. Wood shot her and their three young children. He then wrote suicide notes and mutilated the bodies before committing suicide. An autopsy found he was on medication for depression.
weapon: Excam Model GT 27 .25-caliber Semiautomatic handgun (serial # Serial #20156) killed the victims, and a the killer used a Winchester Sears & Roebuck Ted Williams Pump Action Model 200 .20-gauge shotgun(serial# Serial #2732310) to commit suicide.  He also used a “ginzu-styled” knife and a Corona Professional Folding Razor Tooth Pruning Saw to decapitate, or nearly decapitate, his family post-mortem.

narrative: James Harrison. 34, fatally shot his five children, ages 7 to 16, in the middle of the night after a fight with his wife. His wife was with another man and planned to leave Harrison, according to police reports. The next morning, Harrison killed himself.
weapon: 2 rifles

narrative: As a family meal began, Devan Kalathat, 42, shot his wife and two children; his brother-in-law and the man’s wife and infant daughter; and finally, himself. Only his wife survived. Police believe a feud fueled the violence.
weapon: Pair of .45-cal handguns purchased 1 and 6 weeks before killing

narrative: Four Detroit residents, including a pregnant woman, were found shot at a vacant city-owned house that had been raided repeatedly as a drug den. No arrests have been made.

The 33-year-old man fatally stabbed four people (including two at his apartment complex) and injured two others in series of attacks over three hours that involved robbery. He was arrested at a 7/11 where he had killed a security guard before he was arrested,

After being stopped by Texas state troopers for making a left turn without signaling, the assailant shot at the officers and then drove toward Midland. He subsequently abandoned his car and hijacked a postal van. The gunman continued shooting indiscriminately as he went. He was eventually killed in a shootout with police at an Odessa theater parking lot.
weapon: AR-type rifle
notes: Obtained AR-style rifle from a private seller in Lubbock, Tex., despite failing a background check in 2014 for a mental health issue.

narrative: David Scott Braswell, 53, Matthew Aaron Barber, 26, Jacob Derr, 25,  and Brian Lee Satterfield, 41, were shot and their bodies burned in a deliberately-set house fire, all believed to be connected to narcotics trafficking. The fire appears to have been set to cover-up the murders.

Four residents of an apartment building died in a fire set in the laundry room. A resident heard saying he hated the place was tried twice on homicide and arson charges. The jury deadlocked both times. Charges have been dropped. The case remains open.
weapon: Accelerant such as paint thinner or lighter fluid

narrative: After locking the courtyard gate,  the gunman entered the office of United Homes, a mobile homes real estate  business on West Lincoln Avenue, and opened fire, killing  the owner Luis Tovar, 50; his daughter Genevieve Raygoza, 28; longtime employee Leticia Solis Guzman, 58; and 9-year-old Matthew Farias, who was Genevieve’s half brother. Matthew’s mother, Blanca Tamayo, who is also Genevieve’s mother, was wounded and remains in critical condition. She also worked at Unified Homes. When police arrived, they found Tamayo’s arms wrapped around her son. The assailant’s ex-wife, Aleyda Mendoza, previously employee of the company,

A retiree shot and killed his wife, daughter, son and mother-in-law before committing suicide as they gathered for Labor Day dinner. The killing was precipitated by a "fierce argument" with his wife, police said.
weapon: 9 mm handgun

narrative: Isaac Zamora stole two guns and killed six people, including a sheriff's deputy. Zamora, was sentenced to life in a state mental hospital but returned to prison after doctors said he posed too much of a threat. The state paid victims' families $9 million.
weapon: Lever-action Winchester rifle, a handgun, knife

narrative: John David Young, 38, shot and killed his wife, mother-in-law and two children in the middle of the night, and then killed himself. Deputies were alerted by the mother-in-law, who called police to report "He's killing us."
weapon: Ruger 9mm semiautomatic handgun - "high capacity" clip (City Marshal Rowan Zachry)

narrative: An immigrant from El Salvador shot and killed a woman and three children in their home and then committed suicide. The woman also was from El Salvador and they lived together as a family.
weapon: .22-caliber rifle (according to a Spanish-language site - elsalvador.com

narrative: Trevor Branscum, 38, had been drinking and argued with his wife at a market. Later that night, with his blood-alcohol level four times the legal limit for driving, he shot their four children with a rifle before killing himself.
weapon: hunting rifle

narrative:
A 14-year-old who called 911 about hearing gunshots. Deputies responding to the home in Elkmont, AL found one adult and two minors dead at the scene. Another adult and minor were hospitalized with critical injuries and later died.
 The teenager then admitted to killing five members of his family: his father, stepmother and siblings.
weapon: 9 mm firearm
notes: First names of juveniles not yet released.

narrative: Four men were killed and six others were wounded in southeast Fresno when gunmen broke into a backyard party and opened fire on dozens of people watching football. On December 31, 20119, six suspected gang members who, according to police, had mistakenly believed it was a rival gang’s party and attacked to avenge a murder from earlier that day.
weapon: Gun

narrative: Involved in a bitter divorce, a man shot his wife and four children before turning the gun on himself. All but one of the children died. About two weeks before the shooting rampage, the assailant sent his estranged wife a photo of a handgun with the message “It’s sure happening.”
weapon: Handgun

narrative: The case of Davontae Sanford, who at 14 confessed to killing four people and who later recanted, has drawn national media attention. Sanford, who is developmentally disabled, remains in jail. Vincent Smothers, a contract killer, confessed in 2008.
weapon: .45-caliber handgun and an AK-47"In a written statement obtained last week by the Free Press, Smothers told police he and another man used a .45-caliber pistol and an AK47 assault rifle in the killings. Sanford told police that he used an M14 rifle to commit the crime, but forensics evidence shows that an AK47 and .45-caliber pistol were used.

narrative: Eight family members, seven of them adults, were beaten to death in a mobile home. A child was injured. Guy Heinze Jr., who reported the slayings to police, was found guilty of eight counts of murder and sentenced to life in prison.
weapon: Blunt-force object, probably stock of shotgun

narrative: Police arrived at a shooting to find a 4-year-old girl who had covered her bullet wounds with Band-Aids telling them "My whole family is dead." Richard Terrance Ringold pleaded guilty to four counts of murder, and is serving life in prison.
weapon: 9mm handgun - Police said they recovered 9 mm bullets from all the victims.

narrative: Police found three people bleeding from lethal stab wounds, and a body in the basement. Michael Eric Ballard, who had served time for killing a man in 1991, has been sentenced to death. In 2015, Gov. Tom Wolf declared a moratorium on the death penalty.
weapon: Knife

narrative: Brooke Phillips, featured in HBO's reality series "Cathouse," was one of four killed in a drug dispute.  Phillips and Barrera were both pregnant (which explains why some reports note 6 killed). In exchange for a life sentence,  David Allen Tyner and Johnathan Cochran pleaded guilty and agreed to testify against Denny Phillips and Russell Hogshooter. Denny E. Phillips and Russell Hogshooter were convicted at trial and received life sentences.
weapon: Police: Shell casings from two different handguns, along with several knives, ammunition - Probable Cause Affidavit confirms "handgun" aspect

narrative: Wearing a bulletproof vest, Jiverly Wong, 41, entered a citizenship class and fired 98 shots from two handguns. Wong killed 13 people and injured several more before shooting himself.
weapon: Beretta .45 ACP Pistol, Model BER Px4 Storm, Serial # PK07133 (11 shots fired and purchased about 03/21/2009) and a Beretta 9mm Model 92FS  Serial # Ber430241 (87 shots fired and purchased 03/21/2009).   Weapon info from Court docs and Police Incident Reports etc… Also found with Wong was a "large buck knife with sheath", two 9mm magazines and one .45-caliber magazine.

narrative: A robbery ended with the two suspects shooting and killing four people, then setting the house ablaze in an attempt to cover it up. Rolando Terrell was sentenced to life in prison. Lester Hayes worked out a plea deal and got a 20-year sentence.
weapon: 9 mm semi-automatic handgun - "In his testimony at trial, Lester Hayes described how Rolando Terrell brought a 9-mm handgun and a bottle of Corona full of gasoline to a robbery, then used the gun to fatally shoot four people inside a home and the beer bottle to set the home on fire." (Star-Ledger - April 8, 2011)

narrative: An employee, upset after his supervisor reprimanded him, shot the man and five co-workers at the Atlantis Plastics plant. All but one died. The killer committed suicide at the scene.
weapon: Hi-Point 45 ACP .45-caliber pistol

narrative: Lively James Stratton, 22, was arrested and charged with four counts of murder for the fatal shooting of his four roommates inside  a duplex in the 4100 block of Highland Avenue. Initially, no motive has been identified other than reports that Stratton may have shot and killed the four men over an altercation that occurred earlier that day.

Officers responded shortly after 9 p.m. to a call of shots fired at 1028 Lura Place SW. Three people were found dead, a fourth died at the hospital. Two others suffered injuries that were not life-threatening. The victims were all related. Although unsolved, initial interviews revealed that an unknown vehicle drove down Lura Place “and fired multiple shots at the male in the roadway.” Daniel Baca may have been the primary target on a shooting that also claimed his mother Christine Baca, his grandmother Manuelita Sotelo, and his cousin Vitoria Cereceres.
weapon: Gun, unknown type

narrative: A 28-year-old Maurice Lewis was arrested and faces murder charges after confessing to killing his mother, stepfather and two younger half-brothers inside their home.

On the evening of April 11, 2017, two female associates of the MS-13 lured five young men, including the four victims, to a community park in Central Islip so that Martinez and other MS-13 members could attack and kill them.  The victims were believed to be members of a rival gang who had offended the MS-13.  Martinez and numerous other MS-13 members and associates met in the park where they distributed weapons and discussed the plan to kill the victims.  Once the female MS-13 associates led the men to a wooded area, Martinez and the other MS-13 members and associates surrounded, attacked and killed Llivicura, Lopez, Tigre and Villalobos, using machetes, knives, wooden clubs and an axe.  The fifth intended victim escaped.  The victims’ bodies were discovered the following evening.
Two brothers formed a suicide pact which included killing the other four family members. The police found the 6 bodies while conducting a welfare check.

Thomas Mortimer IV admitted killing his wife, two young children and mother-in-law and was sentenced to four life terms without parole. According to a letter Mortimer wrote that was found at the scene, he hated his wife's parents, with whom he lived.
weapon: Knife

narrative: An 18-year-old, after an earlier disagreement with his father about coming home late, went to his brother's closet looking for clothes and found his brother's 12-gauge shotgun. He proceeded to shoot and kill his stepmother, stepsister, brother and father. In his confession to police he said 'I don’t know why I killed my family today.' He had experienced some personal problems prior to the killings, including moving back into his parents' house after breaking up with his live-in girlfriend and not getting into the Marines. Sentenced to life without parole.
weapon: 12-gauge shotgun (brother's hunting gun found in closet in family's home)

narrative: Dr. Robert Lesslie, his wife Barbara, their two grandchildren, and HVAC workmen James Lewis and Robert Shook were fatally shot in the Lesslie home. Subsequently, the suspected assailant was found at his home with a a self-inflicted and fatal gunshot wound after negotiations with the police failed to get him to surrender.
situation_details: Adams upset Dr. Lesslie has discontinued his medication

narrative: Charles Roberts IV, 32, entered a schoolhouse in an Amish hamlet, dismissed the boys and bound the girls. He carried three guns, a stun gun, two knives, a hammer, 600 rounds. He shot 10, five fatally, before killing himself as police closed in.
weapon:
Springfield XD-9, 9mm Semi-Automatic Pistol, with 10 round magazine, 12 Gauge Browning Shotgun, Ruger M-77 Mark II,  30.06 Springfield Rifle with a Bushnell Scope, 600 rounds, stun gun, two knives and a hammer.    



“Mr. Roberts used the 12 gauge shotgun to fire 3 rounds at the children (and 1 additional round at the police outside the school) - Mr. Roberts used the Springfield 9mm to fire 10 rounds at the children (then reloaded the weapon and subsequently used it to commit suicide – 1 round) - The Ruger M-77 Rifle was brought to the scene; however it was never taken out of its case and was not used during the commission of this crime - Mr. Roberts shot a total of 15 rounds (11 handgun and 4 shotgun).  The rifle was never used.”

(Capt. William P. White, PA State Police Commander, Troop J, Lancaster)

narrative: James E. Holmes opened fire in an Aurora, Colo., movie theater, killing 12 and injuring 70. Holmes, who had pleaded not guilty by reason of insanity, was found guilty of first degree murder. He was sentenced to life in prison.
weapon: All legally purchased: Smith & Wesson M&P15 .22-caliber rifle (AR-15 style); Remington 870 pump-action Express Tactical shotgun, .40-caliber Glock handgun, tear gas. (Another Glock found in suspect's car. Over eight weeks he bought 3,000 rounds for semiautomatic rifle, 3,000 for the two Glocks and 300 cartridges for shotgun. Suspect was dressed in ballistic helmet, vest, leggings, throat and groin protector and gas mask.

narrative: An $1,800 robbery ended in the shootings of five people, four fatally, in a home invasion in the Mattapan neighborhood. Dwayne Moore received a sentence of life in prison without parole. Kimani Washington struck a deal and got 16 to 18 years in prison.
weapon: .40-caliber Iberia handgun (recovered and matched) and shells consistent with those of a 9mm semi-automatic Cobray, which resembles a submachine gun, were found at the scene.  This weapon was also used in the killings but never recovered.

narrative: Three teenagers and a 25-year-old man were found shot along the same block, with the three teens inside a crashed car. Some evidence suggests that two of the teens may have been involved in an aborted robbery plot, but details remain unclear. The suspect knew the victims, but the relationship is unknown. Larin Garcia was found hiding under a pickup truck a few blocks away; he was taken for medical attention, and left without the police/staff knowing. He went to a friend, telling him that he had been involved in a traffic accident, and the friend loaned him money and clothing. Larin-Garcia was then arrested at a Greyhound bus station. Larin-Garcia appeared to be drunk when police found him, and kept giving them incorrect DOB and name information. After being arrested, undercover agents were in a cell with him, and he said that he was "screwed"
Banita Jacks killed her four daughters by stabbing, beating and strangling them. She lived with their bodies for several months. She was convicted of murder and sentenced to 120 years in jail.

Eduardo Sencion entered an IHOP and fired about 60 rounds from an AK-47, killing three off-duty uniformed National Guard members and another patron. Seven others, including two National Guard members, were injured. Sencion shot himself in the head.
weapon: Norinco Arms Mak 90 FULLY Automatic Assault rifle (Illegally modified/altered AK-47 style –Chinese manufacture/banned weapon).  Found in gunman’s vehicle were a Colt .38 revolver, which he used to kill himself, and a Romarm Cugir AK-47 (NBC News is source for weapons). Also found was a Glock 26 (see notes) and 15 extra 30-round magazines.

narrative: A gathering of acquaintances at a North Hollywood café ended when a man left and returned with a handgun, firing 50 bullets, killing four and injuring two. Nerses A. Galstyan was charged with four counts of murder and received a life sentence.
weapon: 9mm semiautomatic handgun - Court docs: "The defendant then left the room and exited the restaurant. He returned several minutes later armed with a 9 millimeter handgun and multiple loaded magazines. Upon re-entering the banquet room, he immediately began firing at the group of people inside. In total, the defendant discharged fifty rounds from a single handgun. Four of the victims were killed. Two others received serious injuries."

narrative: Dressed in body armor, the gunman opened fire in Dayton’s Oregon District, outside the 400 block of East 5th Street and amid a busy nightlife scene of bars and restaurants. With police already patrolling the area, the shooter was killed quickly preventing many more casualties.  But by using a .223-caliber high capacity magazine,  the gunman was able to shoot off dozens of rounds.
weapon: Wearing body armor and had a 0.223 caliber long gun, high capacity magazines, and extra ammunition. Shot gun left in car.

narrative: Just after Omar S. Thornton was forced to resign from his beer delivery job, he opened fire with a 9 mm pistol, killing eight co-workers and injuring two before killing himself. Supervisors had confronted Thornton over pilferage.
weapon: (2) 9mm semiautomatic handguns (Ruger SR9 9mm/17 round capacity and Ruger P95 9mm/15 round capacity)
situation_details: He believed his firing was reflective of racial disrimination

narrative: Police found the bodies of two women and two children in a trash-filled garage apartment. Maryland has banned capital punishment, so Darrell Lynn Bellard will serve life in prison. Tkeisha Nicole Gilmer pleaded guilty in 2011 and was sentenced to life.
weapon: 2 "handguns"  - according to the suspects statements - Washington Post - 09/04/2010

narrative: Ricardo M. McCray was sentenced to life without parole in a shooting outside a popular downtown bar. Four people, including a man celebrating his wedding anniversary, died. Four others were injured, one so seriously that he remains hospitalized.
weapon: 9 mm handgun - Ballistics evidence showed all the victims were killed with the same 9 mm handgun. A witness testified he threw the gun off a bridge at the instruction of a friend of McCray's who drove him from the restaurant.

narrative: Three neighbors who tried to intervene in a domestic dispute were killed after a gunman shot a woman inside an apartment. Dennis Clark III, the woman's live-in boyfriend, was killed by police in the complex's parking lot.
weapon: Weapon: a pistol-grip Mossberg 500 pump shotgun with a four-round saddle (murder weapon) and a .40-caliber Taurus semi-automatic pistol

narrative: Nathan Fortner's ex-girlfriend and two of her relatives were shot dead at their home. The body of a fourth victim was found in an abandoned house where the ex-girlfriend said Fortner had sexually assaulted her just days before. Fortner committed suicide.
weapon: Revolver stolen from the home of a relative of the suspect on or about the day of the murders.

narrative: Vonzell Roundtree, high on drugs, saw two men argue with his uncle in a Southwest Philadelphia bar. When he stopped firing his handgun, all three were dead. A fourth man died of his wounds a month later. Roundtree is serving four life prison terms.
weapon: 9mm Beretta semiautomatic handgun

narrative: Bigamist Christopher M. Henderson and wife Rhonda Carlson are charged with murder in the deaths of another wife, her mother and two children. The victims' bodies were found in their burning house. The woman had recently filed for a protective order.
weapon: .22-caliber rifle, knife or sharp object, fire

narrative: Eight family members were shot execution style at four separate locations near their homes in rural Ohio. A newborn, a six-month-old and a three-year-old were discovered unharmed. The case Involved custody  battle over Sophia Wagner, 3 at time of murder, daughter Hanna Rhodes and Edward “Jake” Wagner.
weapon: Multiple handguns and a homemade silencer

narrative: A 24-year-old homeless man apparently bludgeoned five other homeless men, 4 fatally, with a metal bar in the Chinatown section of Manhattan.
weapon: A metal object, possibly a pipe.

narrative: A fire destroyed a rural home, revealing the bodies of a family of six inside. Autopsies led authorities to conclude that Scott Westerhuis had shot and killed his wife and four school-age children and then set fire to their home before killing himself.
weapon: Charles Daly Field Model .12-gauge pump shotgun

narrative: Four Oakland police officers, including two SWAT team members, were killed after a wanted man was pulled over in a traffic stop. Lovelle Mixon, 26, holed up in his sister's apartment and shot at police before he was killed. A fifth officer was injured.
weapon: 9mm semiautomatic handgun at traffic stop – “SKS rifle” - San Jose Mercury News Editorial (The most recent story)

narrative: Police tailing suspects in a series of drug-related robberies found four men bound and shot in a garage after the suspects left. Police killed Arturo Ibarra after a chase. Raul Segura-Rodriguez faces four counts of murder and charges from other killings.
weapon: .40-caliber semiautomatic casings recovered at the crime scene. Actual murder weapon(s) never recovered.  (Chicago PD PIO)  - Prosecutors stated that the suspects arrived carrying two handguns but Hannan will only count 1 since there’s no way to tell if both were fired.

narrative: Brian Diez, 26, barged into his ex-girlfriend's house, shot dead five adults and took his two young children. He brought the kids to a relative in California before committing suicide. His ex, who was killed, had a restraining order against Diez.
weapon: Glock .40-caliber semiautomatic handgun – from Incident Report (FOIA’d)

narrative: The bodies of a mother and her three daughters were found in the embers of their home. Corey King, a friend of the woman's son, was found guilty of four counts of first-degree murder and has been sentenced to death.

One morning, four years after his fifth divorce, Carey Hal Dyess, 73, drove around Yuma County, shooting six people, five of them fatally: his latest ex-wife, three of her friends and her divorce lawyer. He then pulled over and killed himself.
weapon: Smith and Wesson .38 special revolver-killed himself and the rest of the deceased the victims, Walther P-22 .22 caliber semi-auto pistol-used at the first scene, victim survived, Remington Wingmaster 870 12 gauge shotgun-unused but recovered from inside the vehicle

narrative: Four men were shot inside a stolen car double-parked on a street. No arrests have been made. Police said the attack was likely gang-related.

Offender lived in a group home for the mentally ill and got into a fight with either his roommate or landlord, and set the fire in his room as revenge. Five men who also lived in the home died. Offender is incompetent to stand trial and will be sent to psychiatric care. Victims were so badly burned they are unidentifiable

Neal was suspected to be mentally ill, had just assaulted a neighbor, and was called about DV the day prior to the incident. He shot and killed his wife before going on a rampage to kill his two neighbors, whom he suspected of cooking meth, and then stole their truck to go to the elementary school that his neighbor's son attended. He was prohibited from having guns because of the restraining order, but illegally manufactured the ghost guns at home.

Policed responded to a 911 call in Lafayette, WI, finding two dead (Lailie Vang and the suspected assailant Ritchie German, Jr.) and two injured (Ms. Vang’s parents). The police subsequently went to the home of the suspected assailant, finding three dead victims (the suspected assailant’s mother, brother, and nephew). 
Authorities speculate that The assailant may have been imitating the October 2018 abduction of teenager Jayme Closs less than an hour away.
weapon: Gun

narrative: When Stanley Neace's wife didn't cook his eggs the way he wanted, he became enraged and fatally shot her and her daughter, and then went to other trailer homes and shot three neighbors. Neace, 47, killed himself with a shotgun.
weapon: 12-gauge pump-action shotgun

narrative: Lee Roy Williams told police in a recorded interview that he ''snapped'' after learning his roommates planned to evict him. He pleaded guilty to four counts of murder in the slayings of two men and two women and received four consecutive life sentences.
weapon: .380 pistol, baseball bat and knife

narrative: Maron Thomas spent several months at a state mental hospital after his family was found slain in their home. His 2-year-old niece had been decapitated. Thomas was later tried and convicted of murder . He was sentenced to life without parole eligibility.
weapon: Shotgun and handgun and machete - "Near Cedric Thomas' body, investigators found a shotgun and handgun, both believed to have been used in the crime, he said." (The Houston Chronicle, January 21, 2010)

narrative: Five adults were found dead in two trailers that had been burglarized, one was set on fire. Samuel Lee Conway was convicted in 2011, but the conviction was later overturned. In a 2016 retrial, he plead guilty to lesser charges and received a 40 year sentence for each of five murders to run concurrently.  Jeremy Pickney received 50 years for burglary charges. Marvin Stringer was killed by police.
weapon: At least 4 handguns: .22, .25, .45 and 9mm .38-class

narrative: A romantic dispute led Marcos Chavez Gonzalez to kill his girlfriend's adult relatives and  friends with a high-powered assault rifle. Gonzalez pleaded guilty and was sentenced to three life terms.
weapon: SKS AK-47 semiautomatic rifle - gun never recovered but shell casings were - 7.62x39mm - 19 casings found

narrative: Five relatives found dead after a house fire had been shot, the coroner found. A sixth, Russell Wilcox, died of smoke inhalation. Wilcox was mentally disabled. Investigators believe he killed his family members.
weapon: .222-cal rifle and 16-gauge shotgun

narrative: Several hours after arguing with a man at a nightclub, Zachary Q. Meeks set the man's house on fire. Five kids -- ages 5 months to 10 years -- died. Meeks pleaded guilty. Sentence: Five consecutive life terms without possibility of parole.

A nurse and her three children -- ages 4, 6 and 9 -- were reported missing after the mom didn't show up for work. Their bodies were found in their home. David Cornell Bennett, Jr., a former boyfriend, plead guilty and was sentenced to life without parole.

Angry over the recent number of police shootings of unarmed black men, Micah Xavier Johnson targeted white police officers during a public protest in Dallas. Johnson later fled to El Centro College, where he was killed by police using a bomb disposal robot.
Spencer Hight went to his ex-wife's football party and shot her and 7 of their friends. Hight was fatality shot at the scene by the police.

On January 12, 2010, three people were killed and two others critically injured in a workplace shooting at a truck rental business located near Kennesaw, GA.  Another victim died in 2013 from complications related to his injuries. The shooter, a former employee Jesse J. Warren, was found incompetent to stand trial in 2017.
weapon: 9 mm handgun

narrative: Mark Short killed his wife, three children, and the family dog before committing suicide.

Upset over his finances -- he had lost his job and lost money in the stock market -- Karthik Rajaram, 45, shot and killed his wife, mother-in-law and three sons, ages 7 to 19, in their home in the upscale Sorrento neighborhood. Rajaram committed suicide.
weapon: Handgun - bought September 16, 2008

narrative: Using a stolen Springfield XD 9mm semiautomatic handgun, Chi Dinh Ta killed his wife's relatives who she had recently arranged to have immigrate from Vietnam.
weapon: Springfield XD 9mm semiautomatic handgun had been reported stolen in Tucson, Arizona, in 2017. Authorities  not certain how the offender obtained the weapon.

narrative: A man bound and fatally shot six members of a family in their home. A seventh, wounded, played dead and then alerted police, who arrested Ronald Haskell, 33, in a nearby neighborhood after a four-hour standoff. Tried for murder in 2019, Haskell was sentenced to death.
weapon: Springfield XD 9mm semiautomatic handgun

narrative: A toilet paper roll drenched in paint thinner, set ablaze and thrown at the bottom of a crowded Brooklyn tenement's stairs trapped five victims. Daniel Ignacio received 25 years to life in prison. Officers testified that Ignacio told them he was drunk.

Two mental health evaluators found Christopher Brian Speight insane when he killed eight relatives and friends. Speight pleaded guilty to three counts of capital murder and received five life terms in prison. Police found multiple bombs at his home.
weapon: High-powered rifle, rigged house with at least seven explosive devices, gun collector, took NRA gun course (at Liberty University, 2003), had concealed weapon permit

narrative: Maurice Clemmons used a handgun to kill four Lakeview, Wash., police officers as they worked on laptops at a Parkland coffee shop. He was killed two days later by a Seattle officer at a traffic stop. Several people were convicted of aiding his flight.
weapon: 9-mm Glock Model 17 reported stolen March 2006 from car; .38-caliber revolver Smith & Wesson no sale records after shipment to Lakewood, CO, gun store.

narrative: After leading police on a daylong manhunt, Davon Crawford, 33, shot himself as officers found him inside a West Side home. The night before, Crawford had killed his wife, sister-in-law and three nephews and nieces. He injured his 7-year-old daughter.
weapon: Semiautomatic handgun

narrative: A rookie volunteer firefighter was found guilty of setting a fire that killed a mother and her three children. Prosecutors said Caleb Lacey drove to the fire station and donned gear, wanting to be a hero. He was sentenced to 25 years to life.
weapon: Arson by volunteer firefighter

narrative: Four people were found shot to death in Charlotte's Tree Top apartment complex. More than a decade later, a cold case investigation resulted in the arrest of Dominick Daise. Investigators believe the four victims “were involved in a lifestyle that put them in jeopardy.”

James Kraig Kahler lost his high-paying job after his domestic-assault arrest. His wife of 23 years said he was controlling. He was convicted of killing his wife, two daughters and wife's grandmother, and sentenced to death. His son, 10, was uninjured.
weapon: Not recovered, shells from .223-cal AK-47-style assault rifle

narrative: Four young men were shot multiple times each in a first floor apartment of a Reading rowhouse. The case involves a drug ring.  The police identified Pedro Sanchez-Laporte as a person of interest and announced a reward for information leading to his arrest. He was arrested  in Florida in 2021.

It remains unclear as to why Dimitrios committed the Santa Fe High School Shooting. While some emphasized that he was heavily bullied, was a loner, wore trenchcoats and boots, and displayed an avid interest in violent videogames and guns, others stated that he did have friends, was quiet, had no mental health problems or a criminal history, and displayed zero interest in the recent Parkland school shooting.
weapon: 12-gauge Remington shotgun; Rossi.38-caliber snub-nosed revolver; Explosives; Molotov cocktail

narrative: Chiew Chan Saevang, 38, and his girlfriend, Yer Yang, 40, decided to steal a drug shipment from their partner in an opium ring. At his home, they killed the partner's wife and three children. The pair died a week later in Utah while fleeing police.
weapon: Ozark Trail Knife, Browning 9mm semiautomatic handgun (victims) and Hi-Point 9mm semiautomatic handgun on himself and girlfriend/suspect #2. (Capt. Joel Fish, PIO, Catawba County Sheriff’s Office)

narrative: Joshua S. Durcho's girlfriend had threatened to call police on him, so he strangled her, and then strangled her four young children. Durcho, who had been in prison and vowed not to return, pleaded guilty and received five life sentences without parole.
weapon: Strangulation by hands, cords

narrative: A husband went to his in-laws' house, where his estranged wife was living, and shot and killed his mother-in-law, son and two stepsons. He shot and beat his wife, who survived. Roberto A. Rojas was sentenced to life in prison.
weapon: Llama Max 1 .45-caliber semiautomatic handgun (Serial #71-04-09810-03) and Remington "Sears Ted Williams Model 3T" .22-caliber rifle(Serial #58822). (info from ATF Firearns Trace)

narrative: Five men entered a bar, intending robbery. They shot three and in the melee a fourth man also was shot. Pedro Duran, 32, Renil Escobar, 29, Mario A. Funes, 26, Rigoberto Funes, 20 and Jose A. Cornejo, 22, got life in prison.
weapon: .357 Magnum revolver (drawn and used to hold owner/patrons at gunpoint, but not fired), a Llama .380-caliber semiautomatic handgun and a .22-caliber -caliber semiautomatic handgun . Court docs

narrative: Lee Isaac Bedwell Leeds, who had been diagnosed with paranoid schizophrenia, thought his father, two employees and a customer at his family's junkyard were plotting to kill him. Leeds was found competent to stand trial and was sentenced to 100 years in prison.
weapon: Semiautomatic handgun

narrative: Steven Sueppel, 42, beat to death his wife and four children before killing himself. Sueppel had been indicted a month earlier on charges that he had stolen more than a half million dollars from the bank where he worked.
weapon: Two baseball bats
situation_details: Indicted on charges for stealing half a million dollars from the bank where he worked

narrative: Pedro Alberto Vargas, 42, set a fire in his apartment and shot the building managers who came to see what was wrong. He then shot a man on the street and a family of three before taking two tenants hostage. After negotiations failed, police killed him.
weapon: Glock 9 mm semiautomatic, purchased legally. Suspect had a valid concealed carry permit.

narrative: A 15-year-old used his father's handgun to kill his mother, father and two brothers while they were sleeping, then went to a friend's house to play video games. He had been arguing with his father. He was placed in a rehabilitation program.
weapon: Smith & Wesson Model 639 9mm semiautomatic handgun (fathers) (Balt. County Sheriff’s PIO)

narrative: In retaliation for the murder of a friend, two gunmen opened fire at a backyard party killing five and wounding three. Police have determined the suspect with a handgun shot in a manner that forced party-goers towards a gap in a fence where a suspect with an AK-47 rifle waited.
weapon: .40-caliber semi-automatic handgun and an AK-47 rifle.

narrative:
A 66-year-old truck driver, who had lived in the building for about 15 years, walked into a neighbor's apartment where he fatally shot three men and a woman as they ate dinner. He then went upstairs to the third floor, entered another apartment and shot a woman there. That woman was taken to the hospital in critical condition where she died. 

The assailant was facing eviction for non-payment of condo fees as well as foreclosure on his mortgage. He had filed for bankruptcy in September 2017 in which he reported owing $24,000 to the Internal Revenue Service and more than $60,000 to creditors. 

The assailant left two notes written in polish behind in his apartment reflecting his determination to carry out the murders.
weapon: 40-caliber handgun

narrative: A 14-year-old boy called police to say his father had shot him and his brother. Police found a woman and three children dead in the home; the teenager survived his injuries. Orland Cho, 41, husband and father of the three, later shot himself.
weapon: 12-gauge shotgun (gauge confirmed by Records Supervisor Marsha Dell)

narrative: Three brothers and a friend were gunned down on a porch in New Orleans. Two brothers were charged. One was tried but not convicted. The other, Raymond Amison, agreed to a 10-year sentence to avoid the possibility of the death penalty.
weapon: Police found casings and bullets from .45 and .40-caliber weapons at the scene and from the dead bodies, but no guns were recovered.
situation_details: Escalated fight stemming from long-term dispute

narrative: Said Biyad, 42, slit the throats of his four childen, who ranged in age from 2 to 8. He also beat his wife with a mallet, suspecting her of infidelity, prosecutors said. She survived. He was sentenced to life in prison without possibility of parole.

A 26-year-old man, upset over breaking up with his girlfriend, went to her mother's apartment and shot and killed four people. He later committed suicide when surrounded by police. Among those killed was his ex-girlfriend's boyfriend.
weapon: Colt Government .45-caliber handgun – stolen from an Alaskan military base in the 1960s and then from the killer’s father’s  safe.

narrative: Angry about two teenagers stealing his cellphone, a man set fire to their home. The blaze trapped two adults and four children, all younger than the age of 8. Michael A. Davis was sentenced to life without parole.
situation_details: Revenge against neighbors for theft of a cell phone

narrative: Michel Veillette, 34, hanged himself in jail while awaiting trial on charges that he stabbed his wife to death and then set fire to their house. The couple's four young children, all younger than 9, died from smoke inhalation.
situation_details: Running away to marry his girlfriend, so killed everyone with whom he had ties

narrative: A woman had twice asked the court to seize her ex-husband's long gun after she filed a protective order against him. David Peter Brockdorff, 40, used the .22-caliber rifle to shoot her and their three children before killing himself on Thanksgiving Day.
weapon: .22-cal rifle

narrative: A sheriff's deputy barged into his former girlfriend's locked apartment during a party and shot and killed six people. Two others were injured, including a police officer responding to the shooting. Tyler Peterson, 20, shot himself after a standoff.
weapon: Police-issued AR-15 assault rifle; Glock G22 .40-caliber semiautomatic handgun/suicide weapon

narrative: A drug addict argued with a motel tenant and set fire to the motel, killing the man, his fiance and several other family members. Seven people were injured. Convicted of murder and arson, Sheree Dionne Murphy received five life sentences.

Ambrosio Analco had threatened to kill his estranged girlfriend, the mother of his children. He fatally shot three adults and a pair of 6-month-old twins. His 1-year-old daughter survived her injuries. Analco then shot himself in the chest twice.
weapon: Handgun - Colt MKJV Series 80 Government Model 380 Automatic Caliber, semi-automatic pistol.  Serial Number RR33240 (Wisconsin Crime Lab classification - from FOIA)

narrative: Wayne S. Powell, 41, made good on his threat, pouring gasoline inside a home's side door and lighting it. His ex-girlfriend, her mother, adopted son and a niece died. He was convicted and remains in prison under multiple death sentences.

A couple and their three teen-age daughters were shot with a .22-caliber rifle. Prosecutors said Shawn Bentler, 23, killed his family to gain control of his parents' estate. He is serving life in prison without possibility of parole.
weapon: Remington .22-caliber rifle - "Bentler struggled with his father and hit him with the butt of the Remington .22 caliber rifle forensically connected to the murders, shooting him in the leg and head before shooting the others." Fort Madison Daily Democrat - May 8, 2007

narrative: Angry over a fight, Valerie Moore set fire to a mattress outside a hotel room. The blaze spread through the Mizpah Hotel, killing 12 and injuring 30 others. Moore, who was convicted of second-degree murder in 1987, received 12 life sentences.

A man angry at city officials entered a City Council meeting and began shooting, killing five, including two council members and two police officers. Months later, the mayor died of his injuries. Charles Lee "Cookie" Thornton, 52, was killed by police.
weapon: From Mark's summary: "Weapon(s): .44 Magnum revolver he brought to the scene and used to kill Officer William Biggs, and Officer Biggs’ .40 caliber handgun."

narrative: Michael Simmons has been confined indefinitely to a state mental hospital. The bodies of his wife and her four children were found by a woman visiting their home. Simmons previously had served time in prison for robbing and beating a disabled man.
weapon: Handgun - "The victims had been shot with a handgun sometime between 3 a.m. and 5:45 a.m., the affidavit said." (AP - 10/01/2006)

narrative: Four bodies -- three men and a woman -- were found in a Jeep in a Fresno residential neighborhood. They were bound with duct tape and cable ties. Police said they probably were involved in the illegal drug trade. The case remains unsolved.

A woman, her fiance, her daughter, 16, and the fiance's nephew, 15, were gunned down over a drug debt. Frank Knight, 33, testified against James A. Bishop, 42, and Kelvin W. Kaigler, 28, who are serving life terms. Knight got 15 to 35 years in prison.
weapon: .38-caliber revolver

narrative: William Miller, 28, of Scottsdale, Ariz.,  was sentenced to death for murdering two former employees, Steven Duffy, 30, and Tammy Lovell, 32. They were working as police informants in an arson case against Miller, who also killed three of their relatives.
weapon: Taurus 9mm 6-shot Revolver and .22-caliber semiautomatic handgun

narrative: A 19-year-old with an extensive history of mental health troubles entered Westroads Mall and began firing an assault rifle. Eight people died and four were injured. Robert Hawkins, who declared that "I'll be famous,"  killed himself.
weapon: Century Arms Romanian WASR semi-automatic rifle (AK-47 type) and 30-round banana clip.

narrative: A woman driver was pursued by her ex-boyfriend and father of her child at speeds up to 120 mph. A crash killed her and four co-workers. Kevin Cales, 32, was convicted. He died in prison two years later from a punch by the woman's cousin, Waldemar Rivera.
weapon: Auto accident
situation_details: Accidentally killed everyone in her car when being chased by husband

narrative: At his Baton Rouge, La., church, Anthony Bell, 25, opened fire, killing four. He fled with his family at gunpoint. He killed his wife but released their three kids unharmed. His death sentence is on appeal.
weapon: .38-caliber revolver – handgun  ("The prosecutors said all six people were shot in the back of the head with a .38-caliber revolver. "It's a blessing to have one person survive," Brooks said. - The Advocate - Baton Rouge)
situation_details: killled family members and abducted wife from church but motive is unclear

narrative: Matthew Timothy Wetherington, a 34-year-old registered sex offender, was arrested for allegedly setting fire to his mobile home in the early morning of July 6, 2019, killing his wife and three children inside. Wetherington and his wife Valerie Kambeitz were married two months prior to the incident.

Jesse Wise, 21, beat and strangled his grandmother, an uncle, two aunts and two cousins in Leola, Pa. Surviving relatives asked prosecutors not to seek the death penalty. Wise was sentenced to life in prison.
weapon: Homemade iron bludgeon for those who died of blunt force

narrative: A mother, 19, her son, 2, her nephew, 17, and her father, 60, were found shot at their home outside Winchester, Va. Her former boyfriend, Jessi A. Jephson, 20, was found guilty and sentenced to life in prison without possibility of parole.
weapon: "handgun" - "……...spotted Jephson hiding near the railroad tracks, still with the semiautomatic pistol authorities believe he used in the killings, Eckman said."(Washington Post-Oct 7, 2006). Other accounts unverified have it as a .40-caliber pistol he was charged with Grand Larceny for stealing.

narrative: Conner Schierman, 24, entered a neighbor's house while the man was deployed with the Army National Guard in Iraq. He fatally stabbed the man's wife, two young sons and sister-in-law. He bought gasoline and torched the house. He received a death sentence.
weapon: Gasoline

narrative: Arcan Cetin, an immigrant from Turkey, killed five at the Cascade Mall in Burlington, Washington. A year after being arrested, Cetin hanged himself in his cell.
Five victims were shot to death in police say was in connection with drug activity.

After smoking crack, Ronald Shrieves, 32, stabbed his parents and a niece and nephew in Modest Town, Va., in March 2006, prosecutors said. He pleaded guilty and was sentenced to life in prison without the possibility of parole.

Shayne Riggleman, 22, had been diagnosed as bipolar. He killed five people -- family and friends of a couple who had taken in his ex-girlfriend. He then hit a woman with his car and shot a gas station attendant before killing himself.
weapon: 30-30 deer rifle. A second 30-30 rifle and a .22-caliber handgun, both fully loaded, found in suspect’s vehicle

narrative: Tuan Dao, 37, had separated from his wife and was facing financial problems. His wife had gotten a protective order against him. He and his five children, ages 6 to 12, died in a fire he set in their home. An older daughter and his wife were not home.

Mesac Damas, a Naples, Fla., restaurant cook, faces charges that he slashed the throats of his wife and five children and later fled to Haiti. He has been found competent to stand trial and subsequently sentenced to death.

Police came upon Patrick Dell, 32, as he shot himself on the front steps of his estranged wife's home. Inside, officers found the wife and four of her children shot dead. A fifth boy, 12, was wounded. Dell's biological children were unharmed.
weapon: Handgun - .357-caliber Ruger Six Shot Revolver, Model GP100, Serial # 172-87755

narrative: Paul Merhige, 35, had been treated for depression and obsessive-compulsive disorder. At Thanksgiving dinner, he shot his aunt, twin sisters and cousin and wounded two others. He pleaded guilty to avoid the death penalty and will spend life in prison.
weapon: Handgun – .40-caliber (never recovered) and a Smith & Wesson .38-caliber handgun – verbally confirmed by Jupiter Police Spokesperson Scott Pascarella to Hannan.

narrative: Gerardo Regalado's wife had moved out and started a new job. The couple fought in the parking lot, where he shot her, and then he ran into the restaurant where she worked, targeting women. Four died and three were injured. Regalado committed suicide.
weapon: Handgun - .45-caliber Glock pistol (NYPD – Active Shooter pdf - http://www.nyc.gov/html/nypd/html/counterterrorism/active_shooter.shtml ) Suspect had concealed weapons permit and bought gun legally.

narrative: Police arrested Henry Segura in Minnesota 10 months after his ex-girlfriend and three children were found dead in their home.  Peters and Tamiyah were shot at their Saddle Creek Run home. The other children were drowned and all three were left in a partially filled bathtub. Before the killings, Segura had been ordered to pay back $20,000 in child support for his son. He was convicted of murder in November 2019.

Firefighters responding to a blaze at Fero's Bar & Grill found five people inside stabbed to death. Joseph Hill pleaded guilty to murder and received a life sentence. His brother Lynell was sentenced to 70 years. Dexter Lewis was sentenced to life.

In a protective-order affidavit, Tan Do's wife said he threated to kill her when she tried to leave him. But she asked in March that the order be dismissed. In June, Do shot and killed her, four of her relatives and himself at their son's birthday party.
weapon: Handgun - .Glock 23 40-caliber semiautomatic pistol (FOIA Incident Report)

narrative: John Ragin's wife had taken out a protective order against him, but police hadn't served it before they found her and three of their children stabbed to death. Ragin was convicted of capital murder and sentenced to life in prison.
weapon: Knife

narrative: Alan Atwater, 31, used a .22-caliber rifle to shoot his wife and three children, ages 1, 2, and 4, then himself. She had told him and her friends that she wanted to separate, according to court documents.
weapon: .22-caliber rifle

narrative: Angelica Alvarez, 27, strangled her four children, ranging in age from 2 through 8. Psychiatrists debated her mental health and eventually she was ruled competent to stand trial. She was sentenced to life in prison without possibility of parole.

Gerry Dean Zaragoza, 26, went on a shooting rampage in the San Fernando Valley killing four (including his father and brother) and injuring two others (including his mother). The other two slain victims were a mother of four with whom Zaragoza had been obsessed for some time and a man whom he shot on a bus.  The shooting spree started in Canoga Park, then to North Hollywood, Sherman Oaks and Van Nuys where Zaragoza was arrested.
No arrests have been made in the slayings of four people ages 16 to 34 inside a Detroit home. The day after the bodies were found, the house was torched by an arsonist and destroyed.

David Ison will serve life in prison in the fatal shootings of five people in a rural part of Indiana. According to police reports, Ison had previously purchased drugs from on one of his victims. They fought over the price of the prescription medication.
weapon: Ruger .380-caliber semiautomatic handgun. AK-47 assault rifle found in suspect's car.

narrative: Esteban Quintero Gonzales forced his way into a trailer and shot and killed four people inside, including his two children and their mother, before killing himself. The couple had been involved in an ongoing custody dispute, sheriff's deputies said.
weapon: Shotgun

narrative: Susan Hendricks received four life sentences after pleading guilty but mentally ill to the slayings of her two sons, ex-husband and another family member. Hendricks, who suffered from multiple mental illnesses, committed the crimes for insurance money.
weapon: .38-caliber handgun

narrative: Jose Avila-Alva's wife refused to file domestic assault charges after an incident the week before. He opened fire on his four children in the family's front yard, killing them and committing suicide. His wife was injured but survived the shooting.
weapon: .22-caliber revolver stolen in 2010.

narrative: After he was fired from a Minneapolis sign company, Andrew J. Engeldinger shot and killed five people before killing himself.
weapon: 9 mm Glock semiautomatic handgun.

narrative: Jeong Soo Paek entered his sisters' suburban Atlanta spa and shot them and their husbands before killing himself. In 2006, one sister had gotten a temporary restraining order against Paek, who had threatened to harm them with guns at the salon.
weapon: .45-caliber semiautomatic handgun

narrative: A former nursing student is accused of using a handgun to kill seven at Oikos University, a small private college in East Oakland. One Goh has been treated in a state mental hospital ever since, but in October 2015 was deemed competent to stand trial.
weapon: Springfield Arms .45-caliber semiautomatic handgun – 10 round magazines

narrative: Ian Lee Stawicki, 40, entered a Seattle coffee shop and shot and killed four. He then killed a woman for her car, leading police on a chase that ended with Stawicki killing himself.
weapon: A pair of .45-caliber handguns. Purchased at Bullseye Shooter Supply in Tacoma, the same store the DC sniper purchased rifles at. Suspect in this case bought guns legally because he had no felonies or restrictions to purchase firearms.

narrative: Five men in a homeless camp were killed in a drug-debt dispute, police say. David Cruz Ponce and Max Eliseo Rafael each were charged with five special-circumstance counts of murder. Both pleaded not guilty and were convicted. Ponce was sentenced to death and Rafael was sentenced to life.
Marlon Jones went to a birthday party at a crowded home in Los Angeles and killed a rival Jamaican gang member, resulting in a shootout between rival gangs.

A family had just finished opening Christmas presents when a relative dressed as Santa Claus opened fire, killing six before shooting himself. Azizolah "Bob" Yazdanpanah faced foreclosure and had recently separated from his wife, one of the victims.
weapon: 9mm hangun, .40-caliber handgun

narrative: Tonya Thomas killed her four teenage and pre-teen children, shooting them a total of 18 times before killing herself. Three of the kids went to a neighbor's house to say their mother shot them, but Thomas called them back inside.
weapon: Taurus .38-caliber revolver

narrative: Five people were killed in their home with what prosecutors have described as a "blunt instrument." No motive has been revealed. Binh Thai Luc, 35, has pleaded not guilty to five counts of murder, robbery, burglary and lying in wait. He was convicted and sentenced to life.
weapon: Police described as "an edged weapon"

narrative: Five men playing poker inside a Birmingham home were shot to death. Police said the slayings started as a robbery. Reginald Mims was sentenced to 25 years. Artavius Underwood and Rashad Stoves are serving life in prison.
weapon: (2) 9mm handguns, .38-caliber revolver.  Additional semiautomatic “at hand” but not used according to a witness.

narrative: Officials said a financial dispute resulted in two men killing girlfriends and others connected with a drug ring associate. Zakkawanda Moss was convicted and sentenced to life in prison. Henry Lee Burrell was convicted and sentenced to life.

Ten people died and six were injured after Michael McLendon, 28, went to several relatives' homes firing an assault rifle. According to a letter McLendon sent police, he was depressed he could not be a police officer or Marine. He committed suicide.
weapon: AR-15(Bushmaster), SKS rifle (AK-style), 12-gauge shotgun, .38 caliber handgun

narrative: A man who wanted to abandon his family to live in the Canadian wilderness pulled over their Ford Expedition on an isolated road and shot his wife and three kids. Christopher Vaughn, 32, will spend the rest of his life in prison.
weapon: 9 mm handgun
situation_details: Wanted solitude rather than his wife and children

narrative: A man facing prison described himself as despondent before he shot his girlfriend and three teenage relatives as they slept. Cedric Anderson, who a month earlier had been found guilty of heroin possession, set the house afire and then committed suicide.
weapon: .357 Magnum handgun

narrative: The killer entered a Lane Bryant store on a Saturday morning and announced he was robbing the store. He ordered six women to the back of the store where he bound and shot them. Five died. The case remains unsolved.
weapon: .40-caliber semiautomatic handgun

narrative: Facing a brain tumor and a bitter divorce, James Butwin killed his wife and three children, loaded their bodies in an SUV, took it to the desert and set it afire. A  business partner called police after finding "blood everywhere" at the family's home.
weapon: .22-caliber semiautomatic handgun – Sgt. Mike Pooley – Tempe PD PIO

narrative: In his sentencing hearing, Jordan Adam Criado said he killed his wife only after she killed the couple's four children. Yet a judge said evidence was "overwhelming" that Criado had stabbed and smothered his kids. Criado was sentenced to life in prison.

Forty hours after gaining custody of her deceased sister's three kids, Mary Ann Holder shot and killed two of them, along with two of her own and her son's girlfriend. Police said the stress of the custody case, along with an ended affair, contributed.
weapon: Handgun - Smith & Wesson .32-caliber long revolver - Guilford County Sheriff BJ Barnes.   "All were killed by shots to the head with a .38-caliber handgun," the state medical examiner's office in Chapel Hill found."

narrative: Mark Leo Gregory Gago, 42, used an axe to kill his parents, his girlfriend and their infant daughter before deputies shot him as he was attempting to kill his girlfriend's daughter. Some of the victims were beheaded. The one girl and a 40-year-old roommate were injured but survived the attack.
weapon: Axe

narrative: Rodrick Shonte Dantzler shot himself at the end of a rampage that took the lives of seven people, including his wife, her parents, their daughter and an ex-girlfriend. Dantzler had a history of threats against women, according to court records.
weapon: .40-caliber handgun. Had been stolen.

narrative: Kalcie Eagle, 21, lived a block away from the family he is accused of killing. A grandmother and three of her grandchildren were shot in their home. A 12-year-old who played dead called 911. Eagle stabbed himself to death in front of police hours later.
weapon: .25-06 “hunting” rifle – “The official reports of death signed by Dr. William Massello say Martha Johnson and the three children were shot at 3 p.m. with a 25-06 rifle.” (Bismarck Tribune, November 26, 2012)

narrative: Randle Lee Roberts spared the life of an 8-year-old girl but gunned down the rest of her family, including her mother and 11-year-old sister, as they slept. Roberts fled but was killed in a shootout with police later that day.
weapon: Weapon: Two semiautomatic handguns, one was .40-caliber.

narrative: Four bricklayers were beaten, stabbed and robbed in their apartment, 1,600 miles from home: Villa de Ramos, Mexico. Their roommate Santiago Moreno  was convicted in Mexico, which won't extradite citizens facing the death penalty. Sentence: 120 years.
weapon: Knife

narrative: Sara McMeen, 30, struggled with bipolar medication and postpartum depression. She shot her live-in boyfriend, two children and her 10-month-old daughter before killing herself. Forty years before, her father shot his first wife in a schizophrenic episode.
weapon: .40-caliber semiautomatic handgun

narrative: A woman, her two sons and one son's girlfriend were found in the embers of her home. They had died of gunshots or beating. Troy Brake, 31, was convicted of their murders and is serving life in prison without possibility of parole.
weapon: .40-caliber Glock handgun. Brown was beaten around the head (no weapon specified)
situation_details: Wanted to rape the girlfriend of a former neighbor

narrative: The 15-year-old son of a pastor has been charged as an adult. He is accused of using his parents' guns to shoot his mother, father and three siblings. Police said Nehemiah Griego said he wanted to die while in a gunfight with authorities.
weapon: .22-caliber rifle, .223-caliber AR-15

narrative: A 5-year-old boy escaped and told neighbors "Daddy's dead" right after Robert Brazzon shot his ex-brother-in-law, his wife and their teenage son. Brazzon earlier had killed his live-in girlfriend. Brazzon shot himself after a brief standoff with police.
weapon: Smith and Wesson .45-caliber revolver

narrative: Kirby Archer, 35, and Guillermo Zarabozo, 19, chartered and hijacked the Joe Cool, a Miami-based fishing boat. They shot and dumped overboard its crew of four, planning to flee to Cuba. They pleaded guilty to murder and were sentenced to life in prison.
weapon: A pair of Glock 9 mm handguns

narrative: Kevin Garner's divorce hearing was scheduled to begin the next day. His estranged wife, teenage daughter, and his wife's sister and niece were found shot dead in their home. Garner's body was found 70 miles away, in his house, which he set on fire.
weapon: 9 mm handgun

narrative: After arguing with his wife, a Vietnamese immigrant threw their three children plus his wife's child off the 80-foot Dauphin Island bridge to their deaths. Lam Luong's death sentence conviction was overturned; he awaits a second trial.
weapon: None

narrative: Kurt Myers, 64, shot four people, two fatally, at a barbershop In Mohawk, NY before killing two others at a car wash in the next town of Herkimer. He held police in an overnight standoff before they swarmed and killed him. Authorities do not know what provoked the attacks.
weapon: Mossberg 590 12-gauge pump-action shotgun - Myers legally obtained in 1996

narrative: Prosecutors say recordings show a landlord told his handyman to torch a wood-frame house. The fire trapped three adults and four kids in the attic. Lawrence Myers was sentenced to life in prison; maintenance man Marion Cormier awaits trial.
weapon: Oil and gasoline

narrative: Jason Dej-Oudom shot and killed his children in their apartment before chasing his wife through parking lots, killing her. He later committed suicide.
Gaylin Leirmoe killed his sons, their mother, and her sister at their home before setting fire to it and killing himself.

Scott Lamar Abbott has been hospitalized for mental health issues at least four times. He was sentenced to life without parole after stabbing his ex-girlfriend and three others 95 times. Prosecutors said he was angry about the breakup.

Matthew Denton, 17, drove his Chevrolet Suburban at 97 mph into a Dodge Caravan moving at 50-55 mph., killing himself and those in the other vehicle: a woman, her ex-husband, their son and his girlfriend. The coroner ruled the act a murder-suicide.
weapon: Auto accident

narrative: Three women and a man were found shot in a house about 3 a.m. after neighbors reported hearing gunshots. Two men were arrested the following month. They face charges that carry the death penalty. The case is pending.

Samuel Sallee was found guilty of four counts of murder.The sheriff said methamphetamine was found at the rural home where a couple and two of their friends had been shot. Sallee was sentenced to life in prison.
weapon: Knife, gun (casings found) and rifle(not certain if this was used)

narrative: Four children sleeping upstairs died after the house was set on fire. Four people, including the children's parents, were able to escape from the lower floors. Derrick J. Twardoski pleaded guilty to one count of murder and received a 53-year sentence.

A husband, wife and their three children were bludgeoned with a tire iron. Their former son-in-law, Christopher Harris, did it, according to his brother Jason, who admitted that he watched. Prison sentences: Life and 20 years, respectively.

Tyrone M. Adair, 38, shot himself four days after police found his girlfriend's and infant daughter's bodies in the trunk of his car. His ex-girlfriend and a 2-year-old daughter were shot at their home. Adair was out of work and faced child support costs.
weapon: 9mm semiautomatic handgun - Madison PD PIO Joel DeSpain

narrative: Two men, a young woman and her 2-year-old son were beaten to death in their apartment. Nicholas Sheley was found guilty of murder. Sheley, who faces a trial in the murder of an Arkansas couple, is already serving a life sentence for two other killings.
weapon: Blunt force

narrative: The bodies of a man, his girlfriend and two children were found naked in the woods a mile from their vehicle. Police said the killings occurred over a drug debt. James Roy Belknap received a life sentence for four counts of first-degree murder.

When Daniel Green, who was diagnosed with schizophrenia, stopped taking his meds, he had violent episodes, relatives said. Green has been declared not competent for trial in the shootings of his mother, sister, niece and nephew.
weapon: .380 semi-automatic handgun

narrative: A 7-year-old girl watched as her mother was shot. She then grabbed her brother and walked four miles to a neighbor's house to call 911. Kenneth Lee Myers, 47, shot his wife - the girl's mother - two relatives and an ex-girlfriend before he killed himself.
weapon: 20-gauge shotgun

narrative: Police say the 4:30 a.m. shooting appeared to be drug-related, and that a father-son newspaper delivery team just happened to be in the wrong place at the wrong time. Sidney A. Muller has been charged with four counts of first-degree murder. He was convicted and given a life sentence.
weapon: 9mm Beretta semi-automatic handgun

narrative: Erbie Bowser faces capital murder charges in the slayings of his ex-girlfriend and her daughter in Dallas. Bowser was arrested 15 minutes away, inside the home of his ex-wife, who was found shot dead with her adult daughter. Four children were injured. Bowser was convicted and sentenced to life without parole.
weapon: 7.62 x 25 caliber cartridge casings found inside the homes. A hand grenade was used in DeSoto.

narrative: Aaron Alexis, 34, killed 12 and injured eight in an office building at the Washington Navy Yard. The former Navy reservist was killed by police. Alexis worked for a base subcontractor.
weapon: Remington 870 Express shotgun, Beretta 9mm semiautomatic handgun (stolen from Navy Yard Security Guard Alexis shot).  Shotgun and its ammo  purchased 2 days earlier for $540 from Sharpshooters Small Arms Range (Lorton, Virginia).  Shotgun was legally purchased.  Early reports that he carried an AR-15 were untrue.

narrative: Derrick Brantley and Deshanon Haywood were charged in the execution-style killings of four people in a townhouse in a public-housing complex. Brantley and Haywood were each sentenced to life in prison.
weapon: "2 guns used" Akron PD

narrative: Police were called by a man saying he wanted to hurt himself. After failing to make contact with anyone inside the home, a SWAT team discovered the bodies of five victims, two of them children. Bryan E. Sweatt, 27, had committed suicide.
weapon: "large-caliber handgun" reported to be a .44-caliber, per 911 call.

narrative: At their home in Spanish Fork, Utah, a police officer shot his wife, 2 young children, his mother-in-law and himself.
weapon: Glock .40 Caliber semiautomatic handgun – Police issue - confirmed

narrative: A petroleum industry engineer, his wife and two young sons were found shot in their home about a week after they were last seen alive. Police say they have no suspects.
weapon: Shooting, gun type unknown

narrative: Oliver Bernsdorff killed himself while driving across the Sunshine Skyway. Police found his ex-wife and her girlfriend dead at their home in Largo. At Bernsdorff's Clearwater home, they found the bodies of his two children, ages 4 and 2.
weapon: Paid $321 cash for the 9 mm handgun

narrative: Two men and two women were found shot in a small house in the Southeastside neighborhood. Police said this occurred during a robbery of money and illegal drugs.
weapon: (1) .38/357 class Revolver and (1) .380 semi-automatic handgun

narrative: Authorities found four bodies after putting out a house fire. A couple had been shot execution-style. Two boys survived gunshots but died in the blaze. Two men were charged but found not guilty. The case remains unsolved.
weapon: multiple guns used in the shootings

narrative: Authorities said three teens and a young woman were shot in a car. Jacob Allen Bennett was convicted and sentenced to life without parole. His girlfriend, Brittany Moser, faced charges of felony murder and attempted robbery, and was convicted.
weapon: News reports say a .40mm Glock semiautomatic handgun - "the suspected murder waepon" was found in Moser's car at her house.

narrative: A couple and their three children were found shot in their home. Authorities said Guadalupe Ronquillo-Ovalle killed her spouse and children, then herself. Her husband had been arrested Sept. 11 on a family violence assault charge.
weapon: .22-caliber semi-automatic long rifle

narrative: Michael Guzzo, 56, used a shotgun to kill the family next door -- a man, his daughter, her husband and their son. He also killed two of their five dogs. He crossed a courtyard, fired into a unit where dogs were barking, returned home and killed himself.
weapon: Pump-action shotgun
situation_details: Annoyance from noise of neighbor's dogs

narrative: Police said that at an eviction hearing, a woman used a handgun to shoot five people, four of them fatally, and grabbed a butcher knife to wound a sixth before she was subdued.
weapon: Police chief: 2 semiautomatic handguns, butcher knife - 9mm semi-automatic handgun was murder weapon

narrative: Authorities have made no arrests in the case of two sisters and two men shot to death inside a home in Jacksonville's Murray Hill neighborhood. There was no sign of forced entry. Three died at the scene, while a fourth died at the hospital.

Police are searching for a suspect after four adults were found shot inside a Tulsa home. Six children were unharmed and placed in foster care. The house had been the scene of several drug arrests in the past year, police said.
The bodies of four adults were discovered outside a car in a recreation area near Phoenix International Raceway. All had been shot. There have been no arrests.

Police found Jason Abbott, 18, on his grandparents' porch, a knife to his throat. Inside, they found his grandparents, his aunt and her fiance, all fatally stabbed. Another aunt survived. He pleaded guilty and gets schizophrenia treatment in prison.
weapon: Police described weapon as a Smith and Wesson dagger with a 5-inch blade.
