narrative: A heavily armed gunman shot his way into a gay nightclub killing 49 and injuring 53, many of them critically. The gunman, who was killed by responding SWAT officers, recently pledged allegiance to ISIL.
weapon: .223 caliber Sig Sauer MCX (AR-15-styled rifle), 9mm semiautomatic handgun

narrative: Nengmy Vang was going through a contentious divorce with his wife, Naly. He demanded that she immediately grant him the divorce within 24 hours or he would kill her; he came back and killed two of her coworkers before going to kill her lawyer (Naly was hiding at this point). After killing her lawyer, he returned home to his apartment and engaged in a three hour standoff with police, killing a cop before being killed. Vang had a history of emotional abuse towards his wife, marital problems, potential mental illness, and financial issues.

Justin Painter had been married for over six years. When he filed for divorce, he got a temporary restraining order against his wife, was awarded primary custody of their three children, and was being paid child support by his wife. After attempting to reconcile, he killed the children and her boyfriend and attempted to kill her before committing suicide. No history of DV, although wife claims that he was mentally ill.

Richard Emery had been dating Kate Kasten for approximately a year and a half. Her husband had passed away after a six-year battle with cancer about six months prior to the beginning of their relationship. He had moved into their home, and no one reported any signs of domestic violence, conflict, or mental illness. He shot and killed his girlfriend, her two children, and her mother before fleeing in a vehicle. When stopped by police, he shot at the officers and ran off on foot, attempting to carjack a woman. When her car wouldn't start, he stabbed her (nonfatally) and was eventually caught the next morning in a convenience store bathroom, suffering from two bullet wounds. No indications of a motive.

After a welfare check, police found the bodies of six family members inside their home. Five of the victims, including children ages 10 and 13, died from sharp or blunt force injuries while the final victim was shot to death. The motive was robbery, and the murders as a cover-up.
weapon: Gun/Knives (Chicago police spokesman Anthony Guglielmi said investigators believe three "bladed weapons," which were either knives or other cutting instruments, were used in most of the killings.

narrative: Timothy Ray Jones Jr. led investigators to the bodies of his five children, ages 1 through 8, buried off a dirt road in Alabama. According to police, the children died days earlier in Lexington County, S.C. Jones was charged with five counts of murder. He was convicted and sentenced to death.
weapon: Beaten to death (Nahtahn Jones); All others strangulation

narrative: Orion Krause abruptly left home in Maine, prompting his mother to call the police, fearing he was going to commit suicide. He later called her and told her he was in Massachusetts, so she drove to pick him up and swung by her parents house to visit them. Orion called his former college professor to say that he thought he might have to kill his mother. Orion then killed his mother, grandparents, and their caretaker with a baseball bat. He then stripped naked and covered himself in mud, and ran to a neighbors house to confess.

Gary Lindsey had a history of violent, erratic behavior. After the end of a five-year relationship, he stabbed his ex fiance's TV and then lit her house on fire, claiming that it was going to be his "grave." He had a history of aggravated assault, shoplifting, and many domestic violence charges (for which he served some jail time). He was living in an apartment with his girlfriend, their two children, and her other two children. He had previously beaten her, knocked their 7 month old out of her hands, and held a knife to her throat. DCF had come to investigate several times, but found that the children were not in danger. When his gf called the police this time, he shot an officer (who survived), barricaded himself inside with the children, and then killed them after a 24-hour standoff with police before killing himself.
weapon: he had 2 rifles, 2 shotguns, and a handgun given to him by his deceased father; unclear which if any were used

narrative: Four adults were shot dead in the front yard of an unlicensed boarding house in the Northridge neighborhood of Los Angeles. Ka Pasasouk, on probation at the time, was arrested the next day in Las Vegas. He has pleaded not guilty to four counts of murder and was sentenced to death.
weapon: Semiautomatic Handgun - From the Criminal Complaint filed ……..(“It is further alleged as to count(s) 1, 2, 3 and 4 that said defendant(s), KA PASASOUK personally and intentionally discharged a firearm, a handgun , which caused great bodily injury and death to JENNIFER KIM, TEOFILO NAVALES, ROBERT CALABIA, AMANDA GHOSSEIN – AND……… WITH A SEMIAUTOMATIC FIREARM, in violation of PENAL CODE SECTION 245(b), a Felony, was committed by KA PASASOUK Criminal Complaint Charge)

narrative: Zephen Xaver had a history of being fascinated with violence, and had previously been kicked out of high school for dreaming of committing a school shooting, taking hostages, and dying by suicide by cop. He moved from IN to FL and was living with his mother. He expressed an interest in violent videogames and goth music. He had dropped out of online college a month prior to the shooting, and resigned his job as a correctional officer trainee two weeks prior. After killing four employees and a customer at Suntrust bank, he called the police to let them know that he had killed five people, but barricaded himself inside the bank.
weapon: Purchased a 9mm handgun days before incident; was wearing bulletproof vest at time

narrative: Five people were killed and several more injured in a shooting during a packed Halloween party (with over 100 in attendance) at a rented Airbnb home in Orinda, CA. The authorities identified the four people killed as Tiyon Farley, 22, of Antioch, Omar Taylor, 24, of Pittsburg, Ramon Hill Jr., 23, of San Francisco and Oakland, Javin County, 29, of Sausalito and Richmond, and Oshiana Tompkins, 19, of Vallejo and Hercules.  The sheriff said "there were rival gangs involved in the altercation inside the home. There was also an attempt to steal property which may have precipitated the initial round of shooting. "
notes: On November 21, 2019, the Contra Costs Sheriff's Department and Federal Agents arrested two more suspects on weapons and child endangerment charges, seizing a gun linked to this and multiple other shootings

narrative:
According to an affidavit of probable cause, social services representatives came to apartment for an unannounced visit. After there was no answer, the representative contacted a maintenance worker at the complex. When the maintenance worker gained access to the apartment, he found two women, mother and daughter, dentified as Shana and Dominique Decree, in bed. The worker reported that the two seemed disoriented and the apartment was in disarray. Morrisville police were called to the scene and both were taken to the hospital.  

The two women are each facing five counts of criminal homicide as well as one count of conspiracy to commit criminal homicide. 

The victims were  identified as Shana Decree’s children Naa’Irah Smith, 25, and Damon Decree Jr., 13; Shana Decree’s sister, Jamilla Campbell, 42; and Campbell’s 9-year-old twin daughters, Imani and Erika Allen. Another relative, Campbell’s 17-year-old son, Joshua, has been found unharmed, authorities said. 

There is the suggestion of some type of religious ritual or suicide pact.
weapon: Asphyxiation and strangulation

narrative:
Officials believe the shooting began when the detective approached one of the gunmen at a nearby cemetery in connection with a homicide investigation and was shot dead. 
The gunmen then fled in a stolen rental truck and eventually ended up at a nearby kosher market, where they opened fire on police officers and civilians. Three of the civilians were killed. Subsequent reports suggest it may have been inspired by antisemitism.
weapon: David Anderson used an AR-15-like rifle, while Francine Graham, had a Mossberg 12-gauge shotgun, according to New Jersey Attorney General Gurbir Grewal. Hundreds of shell casings were recovered from the scene, according to Grewal, as well as a 9mm Ruger and 9mm Glock 17. Also found were a .22-caliber Mark-IV with a silencer and a homemade device to catch shell casings.

narrative: Adam Lanza, 20, killed his mother at their Newtown, Conn., home, then drove to nearby Sandy Hook Elementary School. He forced his way in and killed six adults and 20 children with a rifle, firing 154 shots. He killed himself with a handgun.
weapon:
One (1) .223-caliber Bushmaster XM15-E2S rifle (primary weapon – used to kill all except the gunman - 30 round magazine was recovered with the rifle – 154 bullets shot (prosecutors office)

narrative: Frank Garcia, a nursing supervisor, was enraged at two co-workers who accused him of sexual harassment which caused him to be fired. Returning to the hospital, he shot three people, including nurse Mary Sillman and a bystander who attempted to intevene.  Garcia then drove 50 miles to the home of Christopher and Kimberly Glatz, killing both as their teenage children watched in fear.   Garcia was convicted and sentenced to life.
weapon: .40-caliber Glock pistol. Investigators found in his home a Kel-Tech semiautomatic pistol with a magazine containing seven rounds in a cupboard above stove, where a .380 magazine with a belt clip loaded with seven rounds was also stashed. Boxes of ammunition found in a lower kitchen cupboard. "High Noon" holsters found in another cupboard. A 12-gauge shotgun and a container with 103 .40-caliber rounds were found in second-floor storage area.

narrative: Paul Caneiro killed his brother and his family, presumably for a financial motive. The two brothers had established businesses together, but his brother was much more successful than Paul (bigger share of businesses, more money, bigger house, etc.) Several years prior to the incident, Paul was in a car accident that required multiple surgeries and caused immense emotional and physical pain (he was awarded a $120,000 settlement for his medical expenses). The once booming business that the brothers shared had fallen on tough times, and Keith had recently found out that Paul had stolen $75,000 from the business. Keith also indicated that he wanted to sever his business relationship with Paul, and had sent his resume to other companies, especially looking for a job in California. Paul shot and killed his brother and his sister in law before stabbing their two children. He then lit their house on fire and drove home, lighting his own home on fire to make it look like a vendetta against the extended family.

Jennifer and Sarah Hart, two white women, adopted six black children. While they appeared to be a happy family, the two neglected and abused the children. The children were described as obedient "robots" who were harshly disciplined for minor infractions, such as laughing at the dinner table. The children complained on multiple occassions that they were not fed as a punishment, and often appeared malnourished. In one instance, Hannah jumped out of the second story window and fled to a neighbor's house, telling them that she had been whipped by her parents. Devonte repeatedly came to a neighbor's house to ask for food, asking the neighbor not to tell his parents. When the neighbor eventually called CPS, the Harts took the children and drove off a cliff three days later. They have records of child abuse and neglect in three different states dating back to 2013. Jennifer was driving, but there is evidence that Sarah googled "suicide" and "drowning" prior to the murders.
